title: What were the spiritual beliefs of the Celtic Druids and Knights, and what was the author's experience with Arab supernatural practices?
first_phrase: This text is a combination of two parts. The first part talks about the origins of the Celtic tradition and the symbolic importance of the constellations in the southern region of the Bovine. The last 200 tokens describe the author's personal experiences while living in Libya and Tripolitania during the Italian colonization. The author had a keen interest in spirituality and the supernatural since his youth, which was reinforced by his family's background in alchemy. He studied Arabic and was intrigued by the possibility of encountering something extraordinary in the Arab world. The author was appointed to a government position in one of the Italian colonies where he gained further spiritual experiences.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the author's interest in the supernatural and spirituality led him to study Arabic and accept a government position in Italian colonies in Libya and Tripolitania.
